medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent painful bullous and erosive skin lesions.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 19 months before admission, one week after starting citalopram, with oral erosions, tongue swelling, and urticarial lesions. Joint pain, swelling, fatigue, and low-grade fevers followed over several weeks. Symptoms worsened after stopping citalopram and not taking antihistamines (due to religious reasons). Oral ulcers led to difficulty eating, along with painful urination and defecation due to vaginal and anal lesions.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of obesity, hypertension, and depression; episode of Streptococcus pneumoniae bacteremia with complications including tubo-ovarian abscess, bacterial endocarditis, infectious endophthalmitis, and myocardial infarction. Total abdominal hysterectomy and bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy performed at that time.
medical_history.family_history: Father died in an accident; mother had hypertension; an aunt had breast cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Divorced, lived alone; did not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs; reluctant to take medications due to religious beliefs and distrust of the medical system.
